snippet: Greece said it would buy back up to 30 billion euros of its bonds from investors and banks at discounted prices that were higher than predicted.
abstract: Greece, in bold bid to reduce its debt burden, says it will spend as much as 10 billion euros to buy back up to 30 billion euros of its bonds from investors and banks at discounted prices that are higher than predicted.

byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Greece said it would buy back up to 30 billion euros of its bonds from investors and banks at discounted prices that were higher than predicted.

headline.seo: Terms of Greek Bond Buyback Top Expectations
headline.main: Terms of Greek Bond Buyback Top Expectations
headline.print_headline: Terms of Greece’s Plan to Buy Back Bonds Are Better Than Expected
